docs.snippet: Week Ended March 22, 1947 The Canadian free dollar suffered a fresh break in value on a recurrence of the devaluation rumors, selling down to 93.38 cents on Friday, a new low since last July.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended March 22, 1947 The Canadian free dollar suffered a fresh break in value on a recurrence of the devaluation rumors, selling down to 93.38 cents on Friday, a new low since last July.

docs.snippet: Amateur Athletic Union basketball teams in the United States and all quintets in numerous foreign countries will play next season under the same set of rules adopted by American colleges, it was disclosed yesterday as the National Rules Committee...
docs.lead_paragraph: Amateur Athletic Union basketball teams in the United States and all quintets in numerous foreign countries will play next season under the same set of rules adopted by American colleges, it was disclosed yesterday as the National Rules Committee opened a two-day session.
docs.abstract: AAU and colls to use same code next yr; Natl Rules Com approves advisory memberships for France, Spain and Latin Amer countries; other recommendations

headline.main: Same Basketball Code Next Winter Will Apply to A.A.U. and Colleges; National Rules Committee Also Authorizes Foreign Advisory Memberships in Effort to Standardize Sport for Olympics

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., March 25 -- Jonathan Daniels, former White House press secretary, was elected today to a twelve-member international body that will study problems of discrimination and the treatment of minorities.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., March 25 -- Jonathan Daniels, former White House press secretary, was elected today to a twelve-member international body that will study problems of discrimination and the treatment of minorities.

headline.main: 2 AMERICANS CHOSEN FOR U.N. STUDY UNITS; Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES.

docs.snippet: LONDON March 26--Although business in the stock markets today was on a comparatively small scale, moat sections were cheerful.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON March 26--Although business in the stock markets today was on a comparatively small scale, moat sections were cheerful.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Cheerfulness Grows in Most Sections Although Volume Is Comparatively Small

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The American South African Line will resume passenger vessel operations between here and South and East Africa by the end of this year, it was learned yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American South African Line will resume passenger vessel operations between here and South and East Africa by the end of this year, it was learned yesterday.
docs.abstract: To resume passenger service by yr end; pres confirms application for 2 Maritime Comm transports; West Africa Apr 25 service set; current status discussed

headline.main: LINE TO RESUME AFRICAN SERVICE; Passenger Vessel Operations Expected to Start by the End of the Year

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 31 -- President Truman nominated Cavendish W. Cannon of Utah today as Ambassador to Yugoslavia, to succeed Richard C. Patterson Jr., who resigned last week. The nomination went to the Senate on a list with six other ambassadorial...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 31 -- President Truman nominated Cavendish W. Cannon of Utah today as Ambassador to Yugoslavia, to succeed Richard C. Patterson Jr., who resigned last week. The nomination went to the Senate on a list with six other ambassadorial appointments.

headline.main: C.W. CANNON NAMED ENVOY TO BELGRADE; Truman Picks Career Diplomat to Succeed Patterson -- Six Other Foreign Posts Filled

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, March 31 -- Further improvement in British Government stocks, together with increased activity in base metal shares and Brazilian securities were the features of today's stock markets.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, March 31 -- Further improvement in British Government stocks, together with increased activity in base metal shares and Brazilian securities were the features of today's stock markets.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Rise in Government Issues and Activity in Mining and Brazil Stocks Feature Day

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., April 1 -- The United States birth-rate is undergoing the biggest boom in its history, according to figures contained in the March issue of the United Nations Monthly Bulletin of Statistics, to be published tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., April 1 -- The United States birth-rate is undergoing the biggest boom in its history, according to figures contained in the March issue of the United Nations Monthly Bulletin of Statistics, to be published tomorrow.
docs.abstract: UN bulletin shows high '45-46 birth rate; analyzes trend since '15

headline.main: BIRTH-RATE BOOM IS SHOWN FOR U.S.; U.N. Bulletin of Statistics Reveals Effect of Economy on Population Growth

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
